record.author: Davletshin, Albert. 2013. Fieldwork data.
record.notes:
Phononological segments: p (pp), v (vv), t (tt), k (kk), h/s (hh/ss), m (mm), n (nn), r/l (rr), i (ii), e (ee), a (aa), o (oo), u (uu).
Notes: 1. geminate consonants and vowels do not represent independent phonological segments, 2. s (ss) are considered borrowings from Takuu by native speakers, 3. singular and plural forms of verbs (s. and pl. below) are systematically contrasted, I give singular forms only and I give suppletive forms if found in my files.
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Central-Eastern Oceanic, Remote Oceanic, Central Pacific, East Fijian-Polynesian, Polynesian, Nuclear, Samoic-Outlier, Ellicean

record.annotation: (fasten, attach; close, a container with a lid)
a. and b., also flea (flea is Post-Contact)
(of stream and rain water, move fast of humans, go of boats)
(from distance, a column of, also steam, vapour)
